title: Issues with Tk / TCL %clang
body:
I've encountered something worrisome in the TCL installation that ultimately leads to a build failure in Tk.  This is using a freshly installed `clang@6.0.0` via the `llvm` package.

### Expected Result

Tk can build via Clang xD

### Actual Result

The actual installation fails because it cannot `#include <tcl.h>`.

I think the underlying problem here is the fact that the build stage ends up in `tclConfig.sh` (???)  When Tk builds using `--with-tk`, it uses `lib/tclConfig.sh` to set itself up.  The catastrophe is that this is **correct**:

```bash
TCL_INCLUDE_SPEC='-I/opt/spack/opt/spack/linux-fedora25-x86_64/clang-6.0.0/tcl-8.6.6-usupny2noagjhnoblwexhhsrm5gfcawr/include'
```

The only thing I can think of here is that the build stage seems to have ended up in this file as well.

```console
sven:/opt/spack/opt/spack/linux-fedora25-x86_64/clang-6.0.0/tcl-8.6.6-usupny2noagjhnoblwexhhsrm5gfcawr/lib> grep tmp tclConfig.sh 
tclConfig.sh:103:TCL_BUILD_LIB_SPEC='-L/tmp/sven/spack-stage/spack-stage-zxVrqe/tcl8.6.6/unix -ltcl8.6'
tclConfig.sh:138:TCL_SRC_DIR='/tmp/sven/spack-stage/spack-stage-zxVrqe/tcl8.6.6'
tclConfig.sh:156:TCL_BUILD_STUB_LIB_SPEC='-L/tmp/sven/spack-stage/spack-stage-zxVrqe/tcl8.6.6/unix -ltclstub8.6'
tclConfig.sh:163:TCL_BUILD_STUB_LIB_PATH='/tmp/sven/spack-stage/spack-stage-zxVrqe/tcl8.6.6/unix/libtclstub8.6.a'
```

Stranger, though, is it does nearly the same thing with my `gcc@6.4.1`, but Tk can install without issue.  So it's possible my `clang` compiler module is suspect, but given that CMake and friends are able to build without issue, I find that less likely.

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ spack install tk %clang@6.0.0
```

Anybody have any ideas?  I'm gonna start on a more serious debug tomorrow, but I don't quite know how to approach this issue -- the same "faulty" (with stage dir) is kosher with GCC but not Clang?
